Nerangs.ab: barsom sih ud se tāg ud frāgām dō tāg barsom bastan parāhōm kardan sāzišn hamāg xūb frāz nihādan ud ān kas kē zōtīh kāmēd kardan aṣ̌əm vohū ēk guftan ud dast pad pādyāb kunišn

"The barsom (consists of) 33 twigs and the frāgām are two. He should tie the barsom, prepare the parāhōm and dispose all the implements carefully. The one who wishes to perform in the office of zōt should recite one aṣ̌əm vohū and has to wash his hands with pādyāb."

barsom sih ud sē tāg ud frāgām dō tāg barsom bastan parāhōm kardan sāzišn hamāg xūb frāz nihādan ud parāhōm kardan rāy pad har hōmāst-ē pad kamistīh hōm sē tāg urwarām pārag-ē ǰām andak-ē frāz nihišn ud ōy kē zōtīh kāmēd kardan dast pad pādyāb bē kunišn

"The barsom (consists of) 33 twigs and the frāgām are two. He should tie the barsom, prepare the parāhōm and dispose all the implements carefully. For the preparation of the parāhōm, he has to dispose for each hōmāst at least three twigs of hōm, one branch of urwarām and a drop of ǰām. The one who wishes to perform in the office of zōt has to wash his hands with pādyāb."

ab.ab: "... the priest who is about to become the chief priest, comes into that pāvī which is outside of the pāvī of the table of the ritual precinct; (after) reciting one Aṣ̌ǝm Vohū, he comes into the pāvī of the (ritual) table (and) stands near the water container containing the pure implements;"
